newsitem.title: TURKEY: SOCCER-RECBER GOES TO UNITED STATES DESPITE FEDERATION PROTEST.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-RECBER GOES TO UNITED STATES DESPITE FEDERATION PROTEST.

text.p: Turkey's goalkeeper Rustu Recber left on Monday for an operation in the United States despite soccer federation protests that the surgery would rule him out of a World Cup qualifier against Wales.
Recber, who will undergo a miniscus operation in Alabama on Tuesday, told the state-run Anatolian news agency that he would be fit to begin training again a month after the operation.
Turkey play Wales in the European group seven match on December 14. Recber was week selected last week for the team by national coach Mustafa Denizli.

"My heart will be with the team during the Wales match. I wish my friends and coach success. I believe they will produce a good result," said Recber, who said earlier he had no choice but to abide by his club Fenerbahce's decision on the date of the operation.
The soccer federation on Saturday protested at Fenerbahce chairman Ali Sen's decision to send Recber to the United States and threatened disciplinary action.
Sen said over the weekend that he would sue the federation for insulting him.
